sub_topic: Predicting the molecular geometry of a molecule
message_1: What is the molecular geometry of the water (H2O) molecule?
message_2: The molecular geometry of the water (H2O) molecule is bent or V-shaped. This is due to the presence of two lone pairs of electrons on the oxygen atom, which repel the two hydrogen atoms, causing the H-O-H bond angle to be approximately 104.5 degrees.
